examples: {COMMAND} can only be used in a server.
GUILD_ONLY.description: "{COMMAND}" represents the command that was used

examples: {COMMAND} can only be used in my DMs.
DM_ONLY.description: "{COMMAND}" represents the command that was used

examples: This command is locked to NSFW channels only!
NSFW_ONLY.description: "{COMMAND}" represents the command that was used

examples: The {COMMAND} command is currently disabled in this server. You can not use it.
DISABLED_COMMAND.description: "{COMMAND}" represents the command that is disabled

examples: The {CATEGORY} category is currently disabled in this server. You can not use commands from this category.
DISABLED_CATEGORY.description: "{CATEGORY}" represents the category that is disabled

examples: Woah there! I'm missing {CLIENT_PERMISSIONS} permissions! Please give me said permission before using that command!
Woah there! You're missing {MEMBER_PERMISSIONS} permissions! Please get said permission before using that command!
Looks like you're missing {ROLES}! Make sure you get said role(s) before using {COMMAND}.
MISSING_ROLES.description: "{ROLES}" represents the missing roles required for the command. "{COMMAND}" represents the command that was used

examples: You can't use {COMMAND}. It is locked to developers only.
DEVELOPER_ONLY.description: "{COMMAND}" represents the command that was used

examples: {COMMAND} is locked to test servers only and this server is not one.
TEST_SERVER.description: "{COMMAND}" represents the command that was used

examples: Invalid Arguments [Too Many Arguments]; Please use {USAGE} instead
TOO_MANY_ARGS.description: "{USAGE}" represents the correct usage of the command

examples: Invalid Arguments [Too Few Arguments]; Please use {USAGE} instead
TOO_FEW_ARGS.description: "{USAGE}" represents the correct usage of the command

examples: {COMMAND} is on global cooldown! Please wait {COOLDOWN} before using it again.
GLOBAL_COOLDOWN.description: "{COMMAND}" represents the command that was used. "{COOLDOWN}" represents the remaining cooldown

examples: You are on cooldown! Please wait {COOLDOWN} before using {COMMAND} again.
USER_COOLDOWN.description: "{COMMAND}" represents the command that was used. "{COOLDOWN}" represents the remaining cooldown

examples: Invalid Arguments! Please use {USAGE} instead.
INVALID_ARGS_ERROR.description: "{USAGE}" represents the correct usage of the command

examples: That category does not exist.
NON_EXISTANT_CATEGORY.description: "{CATEGORY}" represents the category that the user attempted to disable/enable

examples: That category is already enabled.
ALREADY_ENABLED.description: "{CATEGORY}" represents the category that the user attempted to disable/enable

examples: That category is already disabled.
ALREADY_DISABLED.description: "{CATEGORY}" represents the category that the user attempted to disable/enable

examples: Successfully {ACTION} the {CATEGORY} category.
SUCCESS.description: "{ACTION}" represents the action taken, either "enabled" or "disabled". "{CATEGORY}" represents the category that the user attempted to disable/enable

examples: Invalid Arguments! Please use {USAGE} instead.
INVALID_ARGS_ERROR.description: "{USAGE}" represents the correct usage of the command

examples: That command does not exist.
NON_EXISTANT_COMMAND.description: "{COMMAND}" represents the command that the user attempted to disable/enable

examples: That command is already enabled.
ALREADY_ENABLED.description: "{COMMAND}" represents the command that the user attempted to disable/enable

examples: {COMMAND} can not be disabled
NO_DISABLE.description: "{COMMAND}" represents the command that the user attempted to disable/enable

examples: That command is already disabled.
ALREADY_DISABLED.description: "{COMMAND}" represents the category that the user attempted to disable/enable

examples: Successfully {ACTION} the {COMMAND} command.
SUCCESS.description: "{ACTION}" represents the action taken, either "enabled" or "disabled". "{COMMAND}" represents the command that the user attempted to disable/enable

examples: {COMMAND_CATEGORY} is not a valid command or category. Use {PREFIX}help to view all command categories.
INVALID_COMMAND_CATEGORY.description: "{COMMAND_CATEGORY}" represents the command/category the user attempted to view. "{PREFIX}" represents the current servers prefix

examples: Invalid Arguments! Please use {USAGE} instead.
INVALID_ARGUMENTS.description: "{USAGE}" represents the correct usage of the command.

examples: Please provide a valid role to {ACTION}.
INVALID_ROLE.description: "{ACTION}" represents the action taken on the role, "add" or "remove"

examples: That command does not exist. Please provide a valid command.
INVALID_COMMAND.description: "{COMMAND}" represents the command that was attempted to have required roles added to.

examples: {ROLE} is already on the required roles list of {COMMAND}
ALREADY_ADDED.description: "{ROLE}" represents the role that was attempted to be added to the required roles list. "{COMMAND}" represents the command that was attempted to have required roles added to.

examples: {ROLE} is not on the required roles list for {COMMAND}
ALREADY_REMOVED.description: "{ROLE}" represents the role that was attempted to be removed from the required roles list. "{COMMAND}" represents the command that was attempted to have required roles removed from.

examples: Successfully {ACTION} {ROLE} to/from the required roles list of {COMMAND}
SUCCESS.description: "{ACTION}" represents the action taken, "added" or "removed". "{ROLE}" represents the role that was attempted to be removed from the required roles list. "{COMMAND}" represents the command that was attempted to have required roles removed from.

examples: Please choose a **new** prefix to set.
Successfully updated {GUILD_NAME}'s prefix to {PREFIX}
SUCCESS.description: "{GUILD_NAME}" represents the current servers name. "{PREFIX}" represents the new prefix.

examples: Please provide a valid ISO 639-1 Code, `{ISO_CODE}` is invalid. Visit [here](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639-1_codes) to learn more.
INVALID_ISO_CODE.description: "{ISO_CODE}" represents the invalid ISO Code that was provided.

examples: The language **{ISO_CODE}** is not provided for by the bot owner, please select from one of the following: **{PROVIDED_CODES}**
UNPROVIDED_LANGUAGE.description: "{ISO_CODE}" represents the language code that was attempted to be used. "{PROVIDED_CODES}" represents the language codes that the bot creator has translated to.

examples: Successfully updated {USER_GUILD}'s language to {ISO_CODE}
SUCCESS.description: "{USER_GUILD}" represents either the user or guild that is updating the language. "{ISO_CODE}" represents the ISO Code that was updated to.

examples: Invalid Arguments! Please use {USAGE} instead
INVALID_ARGUMENTS.description: "{USAGE}" represents the correct usage of the command

examples: The max tickets a user can have is already set to {MAX_NUMBER}, please choose a new number to set.
MAX_TICKERTS.description: "{MAX_NUMBER}" represents the max number of tickets a user can have

examples: This guild's settings already have claiming set to {ON_OFF}. If you want to change this please choose a different setting.
CLAIM_SETTING.description: "{ON_OFF}" represents the server's settings for claiming tickets

examples: I failed to find a category with that ID or name, please try again!
The category ID or name provided is not a cateogry. Please make sure you are using the ID or name of a **category**!
This guild has not configured the ticket settings! You can do this with {PREFIX}ticketconfig
Successfully {ACTION} to {UPDATE}
SUCCESS.description: "{ACTION}" represents the action taken, "{UPDATE}" represents the setting that was updated.

examples: Invalid Arguments! Please use {USAGE} instead
INVALID_ARGUMENTS.description: "{USAGE}" represents the correct usage of the command

examples: The max tickets a user can have is already set to {MAX_NUMBER}, please choose a new number to set.
MAX_TICKERTS.description: "{MAX_NUMBER}" represents the max number of tickets a user can have

examples: This guild's settings already have claiming set to {ON_OFF}. If you want to change this please choose a different setting.
CLAIM_SETTING.description: "{ON_OFF}" represents the server's settings for claiming tickets

examples: I failed to find a category with that ID or name, please try again!
The category ID or name provided is not a cateogry. Please make sure you are using the ID or name of a **category**!
This guild has not configured the ticket settings! You can do this with {PREFIX}ticketconfig
Successfully {ACTION} to {UPDATE}
SUCCESS.description: "{ACTION}" represents the action taken, "{UPDATE}" represents the setting that was updated.
